name: Westholme Estate

reviews.text: After booking a Standard Pod, I was terrified of what to expect, I had read so many reviews about RATS and steep inclines to shower blocks etc.., however.. when we arrived I was pleasantly surprised, a beautiful area near Asygarth Falls. The Pod was clean - had a heater and a lamp. The socket came in extremely handy and just outside the pod, yu have your own cold water tap - Perfect :-)
reviews.title: Nice little Podding Weekend

reviews.text: There were NO rats from what i seen or heard - it was pleasant and peaceful.
reviews.title: Fantastic glamping site!!!!

reviews.text: The shower block was rather spooky, we stayed 2 nights and i decided not to have a shower as i was a bit freaked out by the noises!! They do require updating but if youre a proper camper - why would you be bothered? And the "steep hill" is an absolute joke ...there is NO STEEP HILL - more like a small ramp. Why anyone would complain about this is absurd !!!
reviews.title: Would recommend - a great location

reviews.text: The bar and restaurant are lovely - cannot complain. we had a lovely meal here.
reviews.title: Work in progress!

reviews.text: There is a childrens park which you can see when sitting outside the bar.
reviews.title: Rejuvenating!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful lodge,clean.modern,well equipped.Stayed in semi-detached Cedar VIP and yes you can occasionaly hear your neighbours but it was never an issue,especially as the bedrooms and bathrooms are on the outside of the lodges furthest away from each other so there is not going to be privacy issues with these rooms.The lodge only holds 2 people so you are never going to have noisy families next door.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL PLACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodges are well furnished with all you need for a self catering break.The lounge has a comfortable 2 seater settee large flat screen TV digi box and DVD player.
reviews.title: Snowy anniversary stopover

reviews.text: The bedroom has a comfortable double bed and a wardrobe with plenty of hanging space and drawers.
reviews.title: the first mini break of this type and it was fantastic
Will be back again and again
reviews.text: The bathroom was modern and contains the most fantastic shower I have ever seen!! and as an added bonus large white fluffy bath and hand towels were provided.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside on the private terrace was the HOT-TUB!!! what a delight to relax in after long walks on the dales.
reviews.title: Excellent Weekend

reviews.text: A fantastic lodge site in a great location. Made very welcome on arrival by Rebecca. Stayed in a Maple VIP ( VIP meaning with a hot tub ) in Number 24, 03 june - 06 june. The lodge was very nice, clean, modern and amply furnished. The onsite bar/restaurant was fantastic, just like new, great service very tidy and modern looking. All the staff I we spoke to where very warm and friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Will definately be back for another visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic lodge complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had 4 nights on the 30th May 2011 for our honeymoon without our children. We stayed in Cedar Lodge V.I.P (37a) and from the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough to help. We didn't get special treatment with it being our honeymoon, from seeing how they were with other visitors this appeared to be how they treat everyone. This continued throughout our stay and the staff could not be faulted, as they were courtious and friendly.
reviews.title: fantastic shortbreak loved every minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge itself was the cleanest we have ever stayed in and although small there was still plenty of room for two of us. There were plenty of wardrobe space in the bedroom and the shower was all singing, all dancing with f.m radio, light and 4 different shower settings (including back massage), yet was surprisingly easy to use. The kitchen was fully equipt with hob, grill/microwave/oven, kettle, toaster etc and an integrated fridge freezer.
reviews.title: camping pods

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The living room had a 42" flat screen T.V with freesat and D.V.D player. A small sofa, but plenty room enough for two people to sit on. A dining table and chairs were also included.
reviews.title: Great weekend for relaxation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a locked adjoining door to the lodge next door (it was a semi-detatched). Initially we had concerns about this but although we could hear some talking it was not enough to ruin this fantastic trip and you could only hear it from the living room. The bedroom and bathroom is on the outside of the lodge therefor far enough away to not hear anything. After reading some of the other reviews it seems some people had an issue with the patio door. Although initially confusiong, once we mastered it it was no longer an issue.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: Me and my partner and our puppy stayed at here for 3 nights in August. Our lodge was a Cedar VIP which is a 1 bedroomed lodge with a hot tub! The lodge was very nice and was clean and tidy, and although small it was perfectly adequate for the 3 of us. It is well equipped and has everything you need. The hot tub outside is absolutely amazing and very big!
reviews.title: Brilliant weekend away!

reviews.text: The location of the lodges has lovely views, and the nearest village is a few miles away. On site there is a bar and restaurant called Hendersons. It is small, but the food was lovely! And the bar was great for drinks in the day and at night.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday Lodges
very good
reviews.text: All of the staff on site are fab, very friendly and helpful. I

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definatly recommend these lodges for a break away.
reviews.title: Loved the staff, not that keen on the site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this through hoseasons, but if you contact the site direct, apparently it's a little bit cheaper :)
reviews.title: Wonderful place and hope to return

description: Westholme Estate is an exclusive selection of contemporary; log built, leisure lodges, nestled within a sensitively landscaped estate deep in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. Phase 1 consists of 4 lodge styles; each model is fully equipped and furnished offering superior levels of elegance and comfort. Westholme Estate provides you and your family with the opportunity to escape from the everyday world, whenever you desire, to your own secluded holiday home set amongst some of the finest scenery nature has to offer.
